name: tissue paper production | tissue paper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/832/documentation

This dataset represents tissue paper production from recycled, deinked paper. Tissue paper is a hygienic paper which is used in end products such as toilet tissue, kitchen rolls, facial tissues, napkins and hand towels.  ;;Main sources for this dataset are questionnaire from a European producer, information from the environmental report of another producer (Steinbeis Temming (2002)) and the German inventory study about graphical paper (Tiedemann et al. (2000)). Further source is the European IPPC documentation for the paper and pulp industry (European Commission (2000)). ;Reference: ;Steinbeis Temming (2002) Umweltbilanz. Download of May 2, 2002 from http://www.steinbeis-temming.de/site/oekologieumweltbilanz.xml.;;Tiedemann A., Böttcher Tiedemann C., Buschardt A., Georgi B., Giersberg G., Goosmann G., Gregor H.-D., Mehlhorn B., Modi A., Neitzel H., Oels H.-J., Schmitz S. and Suhr M. (2000) Ökobilanzen für graphische Papiere. Texte 22/00. Umweltbundesamt, Berlin

This activity starts with the reception of the raw materials, such as waste paper. 

This module includes the European recycling paper production with deinking - including deinking of waste paper, paper production, energy production on-site, internal waste water treatment.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data represent the average technology in the early 2000s. The production volume is valid for 2014.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from two European producers used as European average data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on literature (see dataset field “Published Source”)
